Title: the property division collision

Amy: If we’re going to be staying in this apartment, would you be interested in doing a little redecorating?
Great, what’d you have in mind?
Well, how about we start a little smaller? Like moving the furniture around.
Look, we can’t just throw away Penny’s stuff, but we can ask if she wants any of it back.
Well, I’m sure she misses this one. I mean, it’s the greatest gift I’ve ever given anybody.
It may have appreciated in value. The artist killed himself shortly after painting that.
I can’t wait to see the look on her face when I give it to her again.
Well, it would be selfish of me to keep it.
Sheldon, you’re, you’re being a little selfish. Why don’t you let Leonard keep a few things?
I don’t think you do, but all right.
I’ve got the Neosporin. Who got hurt?
I think he might be right. Also, who is that?
So, no one’s gonna tell me? Okay.
Sheldon: Oh, actually, I would.
Let’s take every single thing from the other apartment and put it in here.
You know, I have always thought that this couch would look fantastic on the curb in front of the building.
You know, I wonder how she feels about all this artwork.
It truly does capture the beauty of your friendship with Penny.
Yeah, it seems only right that she have it back.
Look, it’s the same smile she has in the painting.
Yeah, there’s hooks in the closet, I can hang it right now.
What happened to them?
You know, Leonard, the more I think about it, there are a number of mutually owned items in this apartment that you and I should go through. Uh, for example, who gets our beloved sword, Longclaw?
That seems fair, we did just give you the painting.
Wonderful, Longclaw is mine. And how about you keep our avocado plant?
Although, Amy and I did just move in together, and a plant is a lovely housewarming gift.
Oh, we got a sword and a plant, our apartment’s really shaping up.
Oh. Remember when we got this at Comic-Con?
It’s one of a kind.
Well, Leonard, you know, who should keep this? On the one hand, I love Mr. Spock more than you do. On the other hand, I care more about clocks than you do.
I’ll be right across the hall. You’ll probably be able to hear it.
Thank you.
Oh, now, what about our 3-D chess set?
Well, no, I just didn’t think you’d want a physical reminder of a game you never managed to win. As a kindness, I should probably take all the games.
Are you sure? These items represent our shared times together.
For a man so good at predicting my moves, how come you stink at 3-D chess?
It’s not my fault I’m bad at sharing, I skipped kindergarten.
Yeah, take whatever you want.
But you don’t even like flags.
But I designed it.
But you don’t even understand its symbolism.
Come along, Amy. I know when I’m not wanted.
Well, powder me in sugar and call me a doughnut, if it isn’t Leonard Hofstadter.
If it’s like your 3-D chess game, then you’re out of your length, width and depth. Amy, get the Neosporin, somebody just got burned.
All right, I tried. That should be the title of your autobiography. Ooh, a second-degree burn.
It’s a good thing you’re cute.
What do you think you’re doing?
This is the level you’re stooping to.

So, there are fresh linens on the bed and, oh, well, now, I see you’ve met Theodore. Theodore, these are your new room mates, Leonard and Penny. They’re very honest, but I would not leave cash lying around.
My room is paid up until the end of the month, so I can do with it whatever I please, which includes renting it out for a dollar a night.
Anyway, I’ll leave you be. I have to, oh, oh, he’s expecting a newspaper in the morning. Apparently, they still make them.
That’s true, but had I done something under the line, there wouldn’t be a man in your kitchen who can’t produce a single form of ID.
And now you know as much about him as I do.
Will you keep it down? What kind of vengeful bed and breakfast do you think I’m running?
I’m being awful? You’re the one who went out of your way to hurt me.
Dividing our belongings is difficult.
I have to admit, leaving you to move in with Amy has been harder than I thought it would be.
Leonard, I would like us to stop fighting about our possessions.
In fact, I want you to keep the apartment flag, and I’m not just saying that because it touched your genitals.
I do. And to show you that there are no hard feelings, I am willing to rub my genitals on it as well.
Penny: Oh, no, no, those hooks are gone.
Uh, we ran out of candy on Halloween, I was just giving everything away.
Amy wants me to have it.
But it’s a picture of you.
But you commissioned it.
But you like it so much.
I seem to be losing.
Why don’t you keep it?
Yeah, I don’t need anything around that I can stab myself with.
So if it breaks there’d be none of it?
Thank you.
Leonard.
Uh, hang on. I don’t think so, I’m clicking on one weird trick for a flat belly, but I’m still seeing celebrities who look like their pets.
Are you sure?
What a jerk.
Well, my go-to move is usually sleep with the person’s boyfriend, but I kind of feel like I’m already doing that.
I think I’m gonna go for a run, you want to come?
What, what are you doing in our apartment?
All right, Sheldon, this is over the line.
What do you think? Should we go to a hotel?
Okay, I’ll go to a hotel. Text me in the morning if you’re still alive.
We’re good, thank you.
Little lower to the left. A little more.
No, still hideous.
Yeah, you’d think that, but after a while it starts showing up in your dreams.
Leonard: Hey, guys, what are you, oh, that’s here, cool.
Yes, you do.
Sounds right, a limited edition collectible worth hundreds of dollars and a thing that grew out of a thing we fished from the trash.
Fine, take the plant.
Oh, yeah. The Mr. Spock cuckoo clock.
So you think you should keep it?
Keep the clock, Sheldon.
Let me guess, you want it.
You know what, Sheldon, take it. In fact, you can have everything, I really don’t care.
Well, now they’re yours.
Well, you know what’s gonna happen, he’s just gonna come up with some reason why everything should be his.
You know what? There is one thing I would like.
I would like to keep the official flag of our apartment.
Yeah, I like this one.
But you made me order it because you were too well-known in the flag community and they’d jack up the price.
Oh, I do. The, the field of blue represents you being miserable, and the lion sticking its tongue out means I’m happy about it.
Is the Wi-Fi working for you?
Oh, I knew it, Sheldon changed the password.
Well, the new network name is ha ha ha, now I’ve got you, so it’s either Sheldon or Gargamel from The Smurfs.
You’re good at revenge, how do we get him back?
Sheldon, I know what you did, now change the password back.
Sheldon, I’m warning you, I can play this game, too.
All right, I tried.
Hey.
Separating my delicates.
No. This is the level I am stooping to. I believe that is flag to crotch four, checkmate. Easy-peasy, ooh, so breezy.
No, last time that old lady in the park kept screaming, watch out, he’s right behind you. Hello?
Uh, can I help you?
Unbelievable. Okay, uh, I don’t know what he told you, but you can’t stay here.
Sheldon, what do you think you’re doing?
And just leave him here alone?
Uh, Theodore, how long are you planning to stay exactly?
This is ridiculous.
Sheldon, get out here.
We lived together 13 years. How can you be so awful to me?
Because you were being selfish.
Why? I said I didn’t care.
Yeah, thanks, but nobody asked you.
Well, for me, too. It’s not the same with you gone.
No.
Well, I’d like that, too.
You promise?
Good?
Well, I’m sure at some point, we won’t even notice it’s there.
Bernadette: Stuart, you didn’t have to get us a baby gift.
A foot massage?
How come this one’s on the back of an eviction notice?
Stuart, we’d love to help you out, but this a bad time, we’re about to have a baby.
Thank you, but I’m not really sure.
I guess you could stay for a few days and we’ll see how it goes.
Hmm. Actually I just did that this morning.
I did that, too.
Howard just did that.
Stuart, you cooked?
There’s only three people in this house, and you’d still be my fifth guess.
You have a Batsuit.
Yeah, we’ve been meaning to do that.
Thank you again for cooking. It’s getting tough for me to be on my feet all day.
Do something, Batman.
Great, go with the giraffes.
Yeah, you’re probably right, go with the zebras.
Hey, could you please go to the market for me?
Howie, they’ve been doing everything for you.
Please just go to the store.
Take Raj. Stuart is supposed to paint my toenails.
I think I’m in labour.
I love you, too.
Stuart: Oh. Just homemade coupons for things you might need help with before the baby gets here. Going to the grocery store, driving you to the doctor, if you’re not in a hurry I can dig you a koi pond.
And that’s not me being creepy, that’s for either of you.
Oh, yeah. Uh, now that you mention it, can I live here?
Or is that why this is a great time? Think about it, when that baby comes you’re gonna need all the help you can get.
That woman didn’t get heat rash once with me on powder patrol.
Thank you. And it’s only temporary, just till I get back on my feet, or the baby goes off to college, whichever happens first.
Well, uh, my car broke down in your driveway, so I’m gonna say now. But I am ready to be helpful. In fact, I’m gonna go vacuum.
Okay, then I’ll dust.
Then I’ll check the batteries in the smoke detectors.
You guys relax, I’ll get it. Have some bread while it’s still warm.
Hey, Raj.
Oh, I’m living here again.
No, I needed a place to stay and, with the baby coming, I figured they could use some extra help.
Anyway, come on in, dinner’s ready.
Oh, okay. Well, if Bernadette wants her ankles to swell up even more, she can have that.
Oh, I know a CPR instructor who’ll come to the house.
I’ll give him a call. We met when I was sleeping on the beach and he thought I was dead.
You just kick back and relax, I’ve got it all under control.
I’m sorry, you mumbled something?
Well, you know what they say, it takes a village.
I noticed the village couldn’t find time to put the crib together.
You mean the one with the empty beer bottles in the sandbox? We’ll pass, thank you.
Hey, what’s up?
Ooh, sorry, I already did it.
Oh, yeah, I read about that on WhoGivesACrap.com
Because I love Howard and Bernadette and if I want to keep mooching off them, I need to be helpful.
Why can’t there be four wheels?
Look, just come in and help me build a baby swing.
If you’re hungry you can eat your take-out, nobody touched it.
Although the high contrast of zebra stripes might provide better stimulus for a developing baby.
Good choice, boss.
Why do you get to do it? I’m the artist.
Just because I look sickly doesn’t mean I’m starving.
I’ll get the hospital bag.
Meet you outside in 2 minutes.
Are we hugging or having a baby? Let’s go.
Howard: This is very nice Stuart, thank you.
Hang on, maybe it’s not the worst idea. I mean, he did do a good job taking care of my mother.
How did you know it wasn’t me?
It’s like we have a butler. If I had a Batsuit I’d be Bruce Wayne.
Get Stuart or Raj to do it.
Mm, I know. It’s really making me lose respect for both of them.
Fine. Who wants to drive me to the store?
Hey, tomorrow who wants to paint the nursery?
Guys, you heard her, go see what she wants.
Oh, oh, okay, okay, uh, uh, uh, I can do this. We have a plan. Somebody please tell me the plan.
Mr Spock Cuckoo Clock: Live long and prosper. Live long and prosper. Live long and prosper. Live long and prosper.
Raj: Hey, Stuart. What are you doing here?
Do, uh, Howard and Bernadette know? Or is it like a possum in the walls kind of thing?
Okay, cool.
Oh, but I bought Chinese takeout.
So, I was reading how it’s a good idea for new parents to take an infant CPR class.
Although it was already under control.
It’s just that they’ve had plenty of help.
Well, they already had a village.
Yeah, well, maybe the village was too busy checking out the local Montessori school for the new arrival.
I’m here to put the crib together.
Well I don’t know if you realize this, but I bought that crib.
Why are you being like this?
Hey, this pregnancy had an emotionally-needy third wheel way before you came along.
Is this what you do when I’m not here, make really good points?
Thank you.
Oh, hey, Bernadette, the swing comes with two different mobiles. The giraffes are pretty cute, what do you think?
At least my nose is naturally brown.
I’ll do it.
Just because you’re starving doesn’t make you an artist.
I’ll pull the van up.
Team Baby, go.
Strange old man: I don’t think so, but you’re sweet for asking.
Oh, I rented a room from your neighbour, the tall guy dressed like a little boy.
Theodore: Oh, oh, I have a receipt from a blood bank. I’m O-negative.
Oh, thanks to the coins I found in your couch, a day longer than I thought.
I like the painting. Is that your mom?
Excuse me. It’s none of my business, but it sounds like a lot of this anger is coming from love.
Well, I’m just gonna keep on talking. Seems like, with Sheldon moving out, you’re in a new phase of your lives and it’s easier to fight than to face the feelings that you have for one another.
If you’re looking for a new guy to live with.
Well if we’re rubbing genitals on things, that’s where I shine.
I think it brings the room together.
